subject: The CNN Political Ticker PM, Wednesday, April 18, 2007
body:
CNN.com - CNN Political Ticker










For the latest, breaking political news, check for updates
throughout the day on the CNN Political Ticker
http://www.cnn.com/ticker All politics, all the
time.

Today on the Ticker

Dems hope for continued 'conversation' after
meeting with Bush

WASHINGTON (CNN) --
Emerging from a meeting with President Bush Wednesday on the
Iraq spending bill, congressional Democratic leaders didn't
back down on their insistence that a withdrawal deadline be
included in the measure.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/dems-hope-for-continued-conversation.html

***

Thompson meets with more than 50
'friends'

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Former
Tennessee senator and possible Republican presidential
contender Fred Thompson met with over 50 members of the U.S.
House of Representatives on Wednesday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/thompson-meets-with-more-than-50.html

***

Supreme Court upholds law limiting controversial
abortion procedure

WASHINGTON (CNN) --The
Supreme Court Wednesday upheld a controversial congressional
law banning a specific abortion procedure critics call "partial
birth," a ruling that could portend enormous social, legal, and
political implications for the divisive issue.

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/supreme-court-upholds-law-limiting.html

***

2008 presidential candidates react to Supreme Court
ruling on abortion

WASHINGTON (CNN) --
Several 2008 presidential candidates have weighed in on the
Supreme Court's decision Wednesday to uphold a ban on partial
birth abortion. 

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/2008-presidential-candidates-react-to.html

***

Emanuel, Pelosi jump on Gates' comment about
Iraq debate

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Democratic
Caucus Chairman Rahm Emanuel, D-Illinois, and Defense Secretary
Robert Gates aren't likely to agree on too much when it comes
to the Iraq war.

Yet Emanuel seized on a recent
comment by Gates that "the debate in Congress has been helpful
in demonstrating to the Iraqis that American patience is
limited."

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/emanuel-pelosi-jump-on-gates-comment.html

***

Schneider: Poll reveals most negative
assessment of Iraq war yet

WASHINGTON (CNN)
-- Pessimism about Iraq has continued to mount, even before the
news of Wednesday's bombings in Baghdad.

In the latest
CNN/Opinion Research Corporation poll, taken April 10-12, 69
percent of Americans say things are going badly for the United
States in Iraq. That's the most negative assessment yet
recorded, up from 54 percent who thought things were going
badly last June and 62 percent in October.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/poll-reveals-most-negative-assessment.html

***

McCain promises public briefings on Iraq war
if elected

MURRELLS INLET, South Carolina
(AP) -- Republican presidential candidate John McCain told
voters Wednesday that if he becomes commander in chief he'll
brief the public biweekly from the Oval Office on developments
in the Iraq war.

Full story:http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/mccain-promises-public-briefings-on.html

***

Democratic candidates slated to speak at Sharpton's
convention

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Civil rights
activist Rev. Al Sharpton will host all the major Democratic
presidential candidates at his National Action Network annual
convention this week.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/democratic-candidates-slated-to-speak.html

***

Huckabee starts New Hampshire campaign day
with 5K run

MANCHESTER, New Hampshire (AP) --
As he campaigned in New Hampshire on
Wednesday, Republican
presidential hopeful Mike Huckabee hit the ground the running.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/huckabee-starts-new-hampshire-campaign.html
